How do you get a geeky name for something so important. Can't we called it "The ultimate defense measure that will ensure you and your family don't turn into radioactive bacon". I think that would get the system more support don't you?

post_info.post_title: Is "star-wars defense system" the worst name ever

The critics of it are the ones who called it Star Wars. o_O

They called it that to make fun of it... Reagan called it the Strategic Defense Initiative. 
 
 And the Liberals made fun of it. Well, thanks to SDI we have things like Patriot missile batteries and we'll have a missile shield to protect us and our allies...
 
 Actually, I read in an article that they might involve India in SDI. It'll be pretty interesting to see how many nations end up being protected...

The critics of it are the ones who called it Star Wars. o_O

 
 Strange how some major things that make no sense exist simply because the critics gave it that name. Republicans being related to elephants and democrats to donkeys were meant as insults when they were first used just as the term Yankee was during the revolutionary war. Also in reverse, hacker was once used as a positive term. I'm sure there are a lot more cases of this.
 
 Regardless of this I'm in favor of a missile defense. It will result in the same type of deterent that MAD would and there would be no risk of someone pressing a button and destroying all mankind. I hope to see it implemented before another world war breaks out and we destroy everything we have worked so hard to create.
Strange how some Americans would support any absurd idea for "National Defense".

Strange how some Americans would support any absurd idea for "National Defense".

 
 Why is that strange? It seems that many countries are willing to support ideas which protect their own land ie military. What makes the US so unique?

Why is that strange? It seems that many countries are willing to support ideas which protect their own land ie military. What makes the US so unique?

 
 
 Well, the missle defense shield idea has many critics NOT because (as some Republins seem to think) we all don't want America to be safe, but because they feel money can be better spent elsewhere to defend America. They feel that the biggest threat to the US is not an ICBM (hardly anyone possesses them) but instead a greater threat is that a terrorist, for example, will smuggle a wmd into the country. That combined with that most experts sayting we won't have the technology to build such a stysem for a long time, forms the basis to the objection of speding vast amounts of money on such a system.
 THere is also, of course, the objections of the US having signed a treaty saying we woulndn't build such a system, and the fear that it will start another arms race.
